FuncDef:
The access-speed adjustment system-state threshold command configures the system status threshold for decreasing the user access rate and the threshold for restoring the user access rate.
The undo access-speed adjustment system-state threshold command restores the default configuration.
By default, the system status threshold for decreasing the user access rate and the threshold for restoring the user access rate are as Usage Scenario.
CLIs: access-speed adjustment system-state threshold { main-cpu-usage | main-memory-usage | access-queue | slot-cpu-usage | slot-memory-usage | ppp-cpcar-drop | ppp-receive-queue | pppoe-receive-queue | l2tp-queue | dhcp-slot-queue | fes-queue | lns-cpcar-drop | dhcp-server-queue | dhcpv6-server-queue } alarm <threshold-value> resume <threshold-value>
access-speed adjustment system-state threshold eap-cpcar-drop alarm <threshold-value> resume <threshold-value>

undo access-speed adjustment system-state threshold [ { main-cpu-usage | main-memory-usage | access-queue | slot-cpu-usage | slot-memory-usage | ppp-cpcar-drop | ppp-receive-queue | pppoe-receive-queue | l2tp-queue | dhcp-slot-queue | fes-queue | lns-cpcar-drop | dhcp-server-queue | dhcpv6-server-queue } [ alarm <threshold-value> resume <threshold-value> ] ]
undo access-speed adjustment system-state threshold eap-cpcar-drop [ alarm <threshold-value> resume <threshold-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the CPU usage of the main control board.
-

Indicates the memory usage of the main control board.
-

Indicates the CPU usage of an interface board.
-

Indicates the memory usage of an interface board.
-

Indicates the rate of PPP packets discarded by CAR when being sent to the CPU.
-

Indicates the usage of queues for receiving PPP packets.
-

Indicates the usage of queues for receiving PPPoE packets.
-

Indicates the usage of L2TP queues.
-

Indicates the usage of queues on a DHCP interface board.
-

Indicates the usage of FES queues.
-

Loss ratio of non-first packets of the tunnel on the LNS side.
-

Indicates the usage of dhcp server queues.
-

Indicates the usage of dhcpv6 server queues.
-

Specifies a threshold for decreasing the user access rate.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 100.

Specifies a threshold for restoring the user access rate.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 100.

Indicates the rate at which EAP packets are discarded due to CAR when the packets are sent to the CPU.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI-aaa] access-speed adjustment system-state threshold main-cpu-usage alarm 90 resume 80
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To change the default system status threshold for decreasing the user access rate and the threshold for restoring the user access rate, run the access-speed adjustment system-state threshold command.
By default, the system status threshold for decreasing the user access rate and the threshold for restoring the user access rate are as follows:
Item

Threshold for Decreasing the User Access Rate

Threshold for Restoring the User Access Rate



main-cpu-usage

90

85


main-memory-usage

85

75


access-queue

4

2


slot-cpu-usage

85

84


slot-memory-usage

85

75


ppp-cpcar-drop

2

1


ppp-receive-queue

2

1


pppoe-receive-queue

2

1


l2tp-queue

10

5


dhcp-slot-queue

6

3


fes-queue

9

5


lns-cpcar-drop

2

1


eap-cpcar-drop

2

1





Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
